what: Tools for Multilayer and Single Layer Network Modeling
title: Tools for Multilayer and Single Layer Network Modeling
text: MixMashNet R package provides unified framework estimating analysing single layer multilayer networks using Mixed Graphical Models (MGMs). package designed analysis complex biomedical epidemiological data, allowing joint modelling conditional dependencies variables mixed types (continuous, binary, categorical), within across multiple layers.

title: Tools for Multilayer and Single Layer Network Modeling
text: MixMashNet provides tools : estimation MGM networks; specification estimation multilayer network structures; bootstrap-based stability edges node-level indices; computation centrality bridge metrics; assessment membership stability community scores; visualization networks associated metrics, including interactive exploration via Shiny applications.

title: Tools for Multilayer and Single Layer Network Modeling
text: development version MixMashNet can installed GitHub:

what: MixMashNet: Multilayer and Single Layer Network Modeling — MixMashNet-package
title: MixMashNet: Multilayer and Single Layer Network Modeling — MixMashNet-package
text: Tools estimating analyzing single layer multilayer networks using Mixed Graphical Models (MGMs), accommodating continuous, count, categorical variables. multilayer setting, layers may comprise different types numbers variables, users can explicitly impose predefined multilayer topology constrain estimation inter intralayer connections. package implements bootstrap procedures derive quantile regions edge weights node-level centrality bridge metrics, provides tools assess stability node community membership. addition, subject-level community scores can computed summarize latent dimensions identified network clustering.

title: MixMashNet: Multilayer and Single Layer Network Modeling — MixMashNet-package
text: De Martino, M., Triolo, F., Perigord, ., Ornago, . M., Vetrano, D. L., Gregorio, C. (2026). MixMashNet: R Package Single Multilayer Networks. https://arxiv.org/abs/2602.05716 Christensen, . P., & Golino, H. (2021). Estimating Stability Psychological Dimensions via Bootstrap Exploratory Graph Analysis: Monte Carlo Simulation Tutorial. Psych, 3(3), 479–500. doi:10.3390/psych3030032 Christensen, . P., Golino, H., Abad, F. J., & Garrido, L. E. (2025). Revised network loadings. Behavior Research Methods, 57(4), 114. doi:10.3758/s13428-025-02640-3 Epskamp, S., Borsboom, D., & Fried, E. . (2018). Estimating psychological networks accuracy: tutorial paper. Behavior Research Methods, 50(1), 195–212. doi:10.3758/s13428-017-0862-1 Haslbeck, J. M. B., & Waldorp, L. J. (2020). mgm: Estimating Time-Varying Mixed Graphical Models High-Dimensional Data. Journal Statistical Software, 93(8). doi:10.18637/jss.v093.i08 Jones, P. J., Ma, R., & McNally, R. J. (2021). Bridge Centrality: Network Approach Understanding Comorbidity. Multivariate Behavioral Research, 56(2), 353–367. doi:10.1080/00273171.2019.1614898

title: Safe graph assembly for mgm outputs (modified from mgm) — Reg2Graph_safe
text: Robust post-processing assemble pairwise (nodewise) weighted adjacency matrices mgm-style object. variant tolerates masked designs empty parameter blocks using conservative fallbacks na.rm = TRUE appropriate. preserves structure original mgm output.

Safe graph assembly for mgm outputs (modified from mgm) — Reg2Graph_safe

title: Bacteremia dataset — bacteremia
text: Example dataset used MixMashNet examples. dataset contains 7240 patients clinical suspicion bacteremia underwent blood culture testing Vienna General Hospital

title: Bacteremia dataset — bacteremia
Bacteremia dataset — bacteremia
text: data frame 7420 rows 16 variables: AGE Age (numeric). WBC White blood cell (numeric). NEU Neutrophil counts (numeric). HGB Hemoglobin (numeric). PLT Platelet count (numeric). CRP C-reactive protein (numeric). APTT Activated partial thromboplastin time (numeric). FIB Fibrinogen (numeric). CREA Creatinine (numeric). BUN Blood urea nitrogen (numeric). GLU Glucose (numeric). ALAT High-sensitivity C-reactive protein (numeric). GBIL Total bilirubin (numeric). ALB Albumin (numeric). SEX Sex 0=male 1=female. BloodCulture Positive blood culture results 0=1=yes.

title: Bacteremia dataset — bacteremia
text: Ratzinger, F., Dedeyan, M., Rammerstorfer, M., Perkmann, T., Burgmann, H., Makristathis, ., Dorffner, G., Loetsch, F., Blacky, ., & Ramharter, M. (2014). risk prediction model screening bacteremic patients: cross sectional study. PLoS ONE, 9(9), e106765. doi:10.1371/journal.pone.0106765

what: Bridge metrics for nodes across communities — bridge_metrics
title: Bridge metrics for nodes across communities — bridge_metrics
text: Computes bridge centrality measures nodes assigned community. Specifically, function computes bridge strength sum absolute edge weights connecting node nodes communities; bridge expected influence order one (EI1) signed sum direct connections nodes communities; bridge expected influence order two (EI2) signed influence propagates indirectly nodes communities via one intermediate neighbor (.e., paths length two); bridge betweenness number times node lies shortest paths nodes belonging different communities; bridge closeness inverse mean shortest-path distance nodes communities.

title: Bridge metrics for nodes across communities — bridge_metrics
Bridge metrics for nodes across communities — bridge_metrics
text: g igraph object edge attribute weight. membership Named vector/factor community labels subset nodes (names must match V(g)$name).

title: Bridge metrics for nodes across communities — bridge_metrics
text: data.frame columns: node, cluster, bridge_strength, bridge_ei1,        bridge_ei2, bridge_betweenness, bridge_closeness.

title: Bridge metrics for nodes across communities — bridge_metrics
text: Bridge betweenness closeness computed positive-weight subgraph , weights converted distances \(d = 1/w\).

title: Bridge metrics for nodes across communities — bridge_metrics
text: Jones, P. J. (2025). networktools: Tools identifying important nodes networks. R package version 1.6.1. https://github.com/paytonjjones/networktools Jones, P. J., Ma, R., & McNally, R. J. (2021). Bridge Centrality: Network Approach Understanding Comorbidity. Multivariate Behavioral Research, 56(2), 353–367. doi:10.1080/00273171.2019.1614898

what: Bridge metrics for nodes excluded from communities — bridge_metrics_excluded
title: Bridge metrics for nodes excluded from communities — bridge_metrics_excluded
text: Computes bridge centrality measures nodes assigned community. excluded nodes, function computes bridge strength, bridge closeness, bridge betweenness, bridge expected influence order one two (EI1 EI2), quantifying role connecting nodes across different communities.

title: Bridge metrics for nodes excluded from communities — bridge_metrics_excluded
Bridge metrics for nodes excluded from communities — bridge_metrics_excluded
text: g igraph object edge attribute weight. membership Named vector/factor community labels subset nodes (names must match V(g)$name). Nodes present treated excluded.

title: Bridge metrics for nodes excluded from communities — bridge_metrics_excluded
text: data.frame columns: node, cluster, bridge_strength, bridge_closeness, bridge_betweenness,         bridge_expected_influence1, bridge_expected_influence2.

title: Bridge metrics for nodes excluded from communities — bridge_metrics_excluded
text: Bridge betweenness excluded closeness excluded computed positive-weight subgraph , weights converted distances \(d = 1/w\).

title: Bridge metrics for nodes excluded from communities — bridge_metrics_excluded
text: Jones, P. J. (2025). networktools: Tools identifying important nodes networks. R package version 1.6.1. https://github.com/paytonjjones/networktools

what: Compute community scores from a fitted MixMashNet model — community_scores
title: Compute community scores from a fitted MixMashNet model — community_scores
text: Computes subject-level community scores. Community scores obtained weighted sums variables belonging detected community, weights correspond standardized community loadings estimated via EGAnet::net.loads stored fitted mixMN_fit object. Scores computed using dataset provided via data argument. data = NULL, original dataset used fit model (fit$model$data) used default. Optionally, percentile bootstrap quantile regions community scores can computed bootstrap community loadings available fit$community_loadings$boot.

title: Compute community scores from a fitted MixMashNet model — community_scores
code: community_scores(   fit,   data = NULL,   layer = NULL,   scale = TRUE,   quantile_level = 0.95,   return_quantile_region = FALSE,   na_action = c("stop", "omit") )

title: Compute community scores from a fitted MixMashNet model — community_scores
text: fit fitted object class c("mixmashnet","mixMN_fit", "multimixMN_fit") returned mixMN() multimixMN(). data Optional matrix/data.frame variables columns. NULL, uses fit$model$data. Errors NULL. layer Optional. fit multimixMN_fit, specify layer score (name index). NULL, scores computed layers returned named list. scale Logical; TRUE (default), z-standardize variables used scoring, using mean/SD computed dataset used scoring. quantile_level Optional numeric 0 1, e.g. 0.95 0.99. provided, percentile bootstrap quantile regions computed community scores (requires fit$community_loadings$boot). return_quantile_region Logical; TRUE, return quantile regions. na_action Character. handle missing values scoring data: "stop" (default) stops missing value present required variables; "omit" computes scores using row-wise omission within community (.e., uses available variables , re-normalizing weights within community row).

title: Compute community scores from a fitted MixMashNet model — community_scores
text: list class c("mixmashnet","community_scores") containing: call matched call. settings List scale, quantile_level, na_action. ids Character vector subject IDs (rownames data). communities Character vector community score names. scores Numeric matrix scores (n × K). quantile_region requested available, list lower upper     matrices (n × K) percentile bootstrap quantile regions; otherwise NULL. details List containing nodes_used, loadings_true,     loadings_boot_available, scaling parameters (center, scale). fit mixMN_fit (multimixMN_fit layer specified), returns c("mixmashnet","community_scores") object. fit multimixMN_fit layer = NULL, returns named list community_scores objects (one per layer).

title: Compute community scores from a fitted MixMashNet model — community_scores
text: function requires fit$community_loadings$true exists input data contains required variables fit$community_loadings$nodes. errors otherwise.

title: Compute community scores from a fitted MixMashNet model — community_scores
text: Christensen, . P., Golino, H., Abad, F. J., & Garrido, L. E. (2025). Revised network loadings. Behavior Research Methods, 57(4), 114. doi:10.3758/s13428-025-02640-3

title: Access internal functions from mgm safely — .mgm_fun

title: Access internal functions from mgm safely — .mgm_fun

what: Bridge profiles of a node across communities — find_bridge_communities
title: Bridge profiles of a node across communities — find_bridge_communities
text: Identifies communities contribute bridge role given node, decomposing bridge connectivity community-specific contributions, excluding community assigned. function designed interpretative companion bridge_metrics() bridge_metrics_excluded(), providing components underlying corresponding overall bridge indices.

title: Bridge profiles of a node across communities — find_bridge_communities
Bridge profiles of a node across communities — find_bridge_communities
text: fit object class mixMN_fit. node Character scalar: node interest; must belong fit$graph$keep_nodes_graph.

title: Bridge profiles of a node across communities — find_bridge_communities
text: object class "bridge_profiles" (named list)   following components: bridge_strength Bridge strength. List overall, total     value across communities, by_comm, tibble     community-specific contributions (community, sum_abs_w). bridge_ei1 Bridge expected influence (order 1). List     overall by_comm (community, sum_signed_w). bridge_ei2 Bridge expected influence (order 2). List     overall by_comm (community, sum_signed_w2). bridge_closeness Bridge closeness. List overall     by_comm (community, inv_mean_dist). bridge_betweenness Bridge betweenness. List overall     by_pair, tibble contributions community pair     (Ci, Cj, hits).

title: Bridge profiles of a node across communities — find_bridge_communities
text: Bridge connectivity summarized using five complementary profiles: bridge strength, bridge EI1, bridge EI2, bridge closeness, bridge betweenness. Notes: Bridge profiles computed using connections focal node         nodes communities different . focal node         assigned community, .e. excluded, connections assigned nodes         communities considered. Bridge betweenness computed counting shortest paths         pairs nodes different communities pass focal         node intermediate vertex. multiple shortest paths exist,         path counted separately. returned object class "bridge_profiles" dedicated print() method (print.bridge_profiles) convenient inspection.

what: Node stability from bootstrap community assignments — membershipStab
title: Node stability from bootstrap community assignments — membershipStab
text: Computes per-node stability given empirical community structure homogenized bootstrap memberships contained mixMN_fit object. Stability expressed proportion bootstrap replications assign node empirical (original) community.

title: Node stability from bootstrap community assignments — membershipStab
Node stability from bootstrap community assignments — membershipStab
text: fit object returned mixMN() (class mixMN_fit), containing $communities$original_membership $communities$boot_memberships. Bootstrap memberships must available, .e. reps > 0 "community" %% boot_what. .plot Logical; TRUE, prints stability plot via internal helper membershipStab_plot().

title: Node stability from bootstrap community assignments — membershipStab
text: object class c("membershipStab"), components: membership List : empirical Named integer vector empirical community labels bootstrap Matrix homogenized bootstrap labels         (reps × p)  membership.stability List : empirical.dimensions Named numeric vector node-level stability         (proportion assigned empirical community) .dimensions Matrix (p × K) proportions         assignment community  community_palette Named vector colors communities,     available

title: Node stability from bootstrap community assignments — membershipStab
text: Bootstrap community labels first aligned empirical solution using EGAnet::community.homogenize(). Stability computed node-wise proportion bootstrap runs node's community matches empirical assignment.

title: Node stability from bootstrap community assignments — membershipStab
text: Christensen, . P., & Golino, H. (2021). Estimating Stability Psychological Dimensions via Bootstrap Exploratory Graph Analysis: Monte Carlo Simulation Tutorial. Psych, 3(3), 479–500. doi:10.3390/psych3030032

title: Node-by-community stability table — membershipStab_table
text: Returns data frame node--community stability proportions, optionally rounded; zero entries replaced NA readability.

title: Node-by-community stability table — membershipStab_table
Node-by-community stability table — membershipStab_table
text: stab_obj object membershipStab(). digits Integer; decimal places rounding.

title: Node-by-community stability table — membershipStab_table
text: data.frame rows = nodes columns = communities (D1..DK).

title: Masked MGM (modified from mgm) — mgm_masked
text: modified version model-fitting routine mgm adds support per-node predictor mask via mask_list. provided, node estimated using allowed predictors specified node. functionality mirrors original mgm nodewise estimation graph assembly.

title: Masked MGM (modified from mgm) — mgm_masked
code: mgm_masked(   data,   type,   level,   regularize,   lambdaSeq,   lambdaSel,   lambdaFolds,   lambdaGam,   alphaSeq,   alphaSel,   alphaFolds,   alphaGam,   k,   moderators,   ruleReg,   weights,   threshold,   method,   binarySign,   scale,   verbatim,   pbar,   warnings,   saveModels,   saveData,   overparameterize,   thresholdCat,   signInfo,   mask_list = NULL,   ... )

title: Masked MGM (modified from mgm) — mgm_masked
text: data Numeric matrix (n × p). missing values allowed. type Character vector length p variable types mgm (e.g., "g" Gaussian, "c" categorical, "p" Poisson). level Integer vector length p variable levels mgm. regularize Logical; FALSE, equivalent regularization (lambdaSel = "EBIC", lambdaSeq = 0, threshold = "none"). lambdaSeq, lambdaSel, lambdaFolds, lambdaGam Lambda grid/selection settings (see mgm). alphaSeq, alphaSel, alphaFolds, alphaGam Mixing parameter grid/selection (see mgm). k Interaction order (default 2); meaning mgm. moderators Optional moderators specification (mgm). ruleReg Regularization rule, default "" (mgm). weights Observation weights (length n); internally normalized. threshold Thresholding rule (default "LW") mgm. method Fitting backend (default "glm") mgm. binarySign Logical; TRUE, store sign information. scale Logical; TRUE, standardize Gaussian variables. verbatim, pbar, warnings, saveModels, saveData Overhead/UX flags mgm. overparameterize Logical; use overparameterized design matrix (mgm). thresholdCat Logical; categorical thresholding (mgm). signInfo Logical; store sign information (mgm). mask_list Optional list length p; element integer vector column indices (1..p) indicating predictors allowed nodewise regression corresponding target node. NULL, masking applied. ... arguments forwarded consistently mgm.

title: Masked MGM (modified from mgm) — mgm_masked
text: object class c("mgm","core") fields analogous mgm: $pairwise$: wadj, signs, nodewise variants. $interactions$, $intercepts$, $nodemodels$: mgm. $call$: input metadata (types, levels, thresholds, etc.).

title: Masked MGM (modified from mgm) — mgm_masked
text: function adapted mgm workflow preserves nodewise estimation, cross-validation / EBIC selection, thresholding, graph assembly. substantive extension mask_list, filters node's design matrix allowed predictors fitting. enables constrained structures (e.g., multilayer masks) keeping mgm’s estimation logic intact.

what: Estimate single layer MGM network with bootstrap centrality, bridge metrics, clustering, and (optionally) community score loadings — mixMN
title: Estimate single layer MGM network with bootstrap centrality, bridge metrics, clustering, and (optionally) community score loadings — mixMN
text: Estimates single layer Mixed Graphical Model (MGM) network original data, using estimation framework implemented mgm package, performs non-parametric bootstrap (row resampling) compute centrality indices, bridge metrics, clustering stability, quantile regions node metrics edge weights. Optionally, function computes community score loadings (later prediction new data) can bootstrap corresponding loadings.

title: Estimate single layer MGM network with bootstrap centrality, bridge metrics, clustering, and (optionally) community score loadings — mixMN
code: mixMN(   data,   reps = 100,   scale = TRUE,   lambdaSel = c("CV", "EBIC"),   lambdaFolds = 5,   lambdaGam = 0.25,   alphaSeq = 1,   alphaSel = "CV",   alphaFolds = 5,   alphaGam = 0.25,   k = 2,   ruleReg = "AND",   threshold = "LW",   overparameterize = FALSE,   thresholdCat = TRUE,   quantile_level = 0.95,   covariates = NULL,   exclude_from_cluster = NULL,   treat_singletons_as_excluded = FALSE,   seed_model = NULL,   seed_boot = NULL,   cluster_method = c("louvain", "fast_greedy", "infomap", "walktrap", "edge_betweenness"),   compute_loadings = TRUE,   boot_what = c("general_index", "bridge_index", "excluded_index", "community",     "loadings"),   save_data = FALSE,   progress = TRUE )

title: Estimate single layer MGM network with bootstrap centrality, bridge metrics, clustering, and (optionally) community score loadings — mixMN
text: data data.frame (n x p) variables columns. Variables may numeric, integer, logical, factors. Character Date/POSIXt variables supported must converted prior model fitting. Variable types internally mapped MGM types follows: numeric variables treated Gaussian; integer variables treated Poisson unless take values {0,1}, case treated binary categorical; factors logical variables treated categorical. Binary categorical variables (two-level factors logical variables) internally recoded {0,1} model fitting. original input data modified. reps Integer (>= 0). Number bootstrap replications. scale Logical; TRUE (default) Gaussian variables (type == "g") z-standardized internally mgm(). Use scale = FALSE data already standardized. lambdaSel Method lambda selection: "CV" "EBIC". lambdaFolds Number folds CV (lambdaSel = "CV"). lambdaGam EBIC gamma parameter (lambdaSel = "EBIC"). alphaSeq Alpha parameters elastic net penalty (values 0 1). alphaSel Method selecting alpha parameter: "CV" "EBIC". alphaFolds Number folds CV (alphaSel = "CV"). alphaGam EBIC gamma parameter (alphaSel = "EBIC"). k Integer (>= 1). Order modeled interactions. ruleReg Rule combine neighborhood estimates: "" "". threshold Threshold edge-weights set zero: "LW", "HW" "none". overparameterize Logical; TRUE uses -parameterized version mgm. thresholdCat Logical; FALSE thresholds categorical variables set zero. quantile_level Level central bootstrap quantile region (default 0.95). Must single number 0 1. covariates Character vector. Variables used adjustment covariates model estimation. exclude_from_cluster Character vector. Nodes excluded community detection (addition covariates). treat_singletons_as_excluded Logical; TRUE, singleton communities (size 1) treated excluded nodes computing bridge metrics. seed_model Optional integer seed reproducibility initial MGM fit. seed_boot Optional integer seed passed future.apply reproducibility bootstrap replications. cluster_method Community detection algorithm used network: "louvain", "fast_greedy", "infomap", "walktrap", "edge_betweenness". compute_loadings Logical; TRUE (default), compute network loadings (EGAnet net.loads) communities. boot_what Character vector specifying quantities bootstrap. Valid options :  "general_index" (centrality indices),  "bridge_index" (bridge metrics nodes communities),  "excluded_index" (bridge metrics nodes treated excluded),  "community" (community memberships),  "loadings" (community loadings, compute_loadings = TRUE),  "none" (skip node-level bootstrap: edge-weight  bootstrap performed reps > 0). save_data Logical; TRUE, store original data output object. progress Logical; TRUE (default), show bootstrap progress bar.

title: Estimate single layer MGM network with bootstrap centrality, bridge metrics, clustering, and (optionally) community score loadings — mixMN
text: object class c("mixmashnet", "mixMN_fit"), list following top-level components: call matched function call. settings List main settings used call, including     reps, cluster_method,     covariates, exclude_from_cluster,     treat_singletons_as_excluded, boot_what. data_info List information derived input data used model setup:     mgm_type_level (data frame one row per variable, reporting     original R class inferred MGM type level,     used call mgm::mgm),     binary_recode_map (named list describing mapping     original binary labels internal {0,1} coding used model fitting). model List :     mgm (fitted mgm object),     nodes (character vector node names),     n (number observations),     p (number variables),     data. graph List describing graph:     igraph (igraph object built     keep_nodes_graph, edge attributes     weight, abs_weight, sign vertex attribute     membership communities),     keep_nodes_graph (nodes retained graph node-level     metrics), keep_nodes_cluster (nodes used community     detection). communities List describing community structure :     original_membership (integer vector community labels     keep_nodes_cluster),     groups (factor community labels actually used bridge     metrics, optionally singletons treated excluded),     palette (named vector colors per community),     boot_memberships (list bootstrap memberships     "community" requested boot_what, otherwise empty     list). statistics List node- edge-level summaries:     node list :     true (data frame one row per node     keep_nodes_graph, containing node name metrics     strength, ei1, closeness, betweenness,     bridge_strength, bridge_betweenness, bridge_closeness,     bridge_ei1, bridge_ei2, nodes treated excluded     communities also     bridge_strength_excluded,     bridge_betweenness_excluded,     bridge_closeness_excluded,     bridge_ei1_excluded, bridge_ei2_excluded);     boot (list bootstrap matrices metric,     dimension reps x length(keep_nodes_graph), possibly NULL     metric requested reps = 0);     quantile_region (list quantile regions node metric, one     p x 2 matrix per metric, columns corresponding lower upper     quantile bounds implied quantile_level, NULL bootstrap performed). edge list :     true (data frame columns edge weight     unique undirected edges among keep_nodes_graph);     boot (matrix bootstrap edge weights dimension     n_edges x reps);     quantile_region (matrix quantile regions edge weights,     n_edges x 2, columns corresponding lower upper     bootstrap quantile bounds, NULL reps = 0). community_loadings List containing community-loading information (based     EGAnet::net.loads) later community-score computation new     data:     nodes (nodes used loadings),     wc (integer community labels aligned nodes),     true (matrix standardized loadings, nodes x communities),     boot (list bootstrap loading matrices, one per replication,     NULL bootstrapped).

title: Estimate single layer MGM network with bootstrap centrality, bridge metrics, clustering, and (optionally) community score loadings — mixMN
text: function call future::plan(). enable parallel bootstrap, set plan (e.g. future::plan(multisession)) calling mixMN(). boot_what "none" reps > 0, node-level metrics bootstrapped edge-weight bootstrap corresponding quantile regions still computed.

title: Estimate single layer MGM network with bootstrap centrality, bridge metrics, clustering, and (optionally) community score loadings — mixMN
text: Haslbeck, J. M. B., & Waldorp, L. J. (2020). mgm: Estimating Time-Varying Mixed Graphical Models High-Dimensional Data. Journal Statistical Software, 93(8). doi:10.18637/jss.v093.i08

what: Build MixMashNet metrics from a signed weighted adjacency matrix — mixMN_from_wadj
title: Build MixMashNet metrics from a signed weighted adjacency matrix — mixMN_from_wadj
text: Low-level constructor computes clustering, centrality, bridge metrics signed weighted adjacency matrix. returns mixMN_fit object analogous quello prodotto da mixMN(), ma stimato direttamente da wadj_signed invece che da mgm(). arguments reps, seed_boot, boot_what stored $settings compatibility bootstrap-based functions, bootstrap performed inside function.

title: Build MixMashNet metrics from a signed weighted adjacency matrix — mixMN_from_wadj
code: mixMN_from_wadj(   wadj_signed,   nodes,   conf_level = 0.95,   exclude_from_graph = NULL,   exclude_from_cluster = NULL,   cluster_method = c("louvain", "fast_greedy", "infomap", "walktrap", "edge_betweenness"),   reps = 0,   seed_boot = NULL,   treat_singletons_as_excluded = FALSE,   boot_what = c("general_index", "interlayer_index", "bridge_index", "excluded_index",     "community", "community_scores", "none") )

title: Build MixMashNet metrics from a signed weighted adjacency matrix — mixMN_from_wadj
text: wadj_signed Square numeric matrix signed edge weights (rows/columns = nodes). Typically wadj * signs mgm. nodes Character vector node names (must match rownames(wadj_signed) colnames(wadj_signed)). conf_level Confidence level percentile bootstrap CIs (default 0.95). Stored $settings consistency mixMN(). exclude_from_graph Character vector nodes exclude entirely graph (edges, centralities). exclude_from_cluster Character vector nodes exclude clustering (remain graph, community label). cluster_method Community detection algorithm, one c("louvain","fast_greedy","infomap","walktrap","edge_betweenness"). reps Integer; number bootstrap replications. Currently used inside function, saved $settings$reps consistency mixMN() downstream bootstrap utilities. seed_boot Optional integer; bootstrap seed, stored $settings used . treat_singletons_as_excluded Logical; TRUE, communities size 1 treated "excluded" (nodes receive NA community labels). boot_what Character vector specifying quantities meant bootstrapped higher-level functions: can include "general_index", "interlayer_index", "bridge_index", "excluded_index", "community", "community_scores", "none". value stored $settings$boot_what bootstrap computed .

title: Build MixMashNet metrics from a signed weighted adjacency matrix — mixMN_from_wadj
text: object class c("mixmashnet","mixMN_fit") : graph List : igraph (signed network), keep_nodes_graph, keep_nodes_cluster. communities List empirical community structure (original_membership, groups), color palette (palette), empty boot_memberships. statistics Node-level metrics $statistics$node$true (strength, EI1, closeness, betweenness, bridge metrics, including "excluded" versions) edge weights $statistics$edge$true. Bootstrap slots ($statistics$node$boot, $statistics$edge$boot, $statistics$node$ci, $statistics$edge$ci) set NULL. community_scores Empty containers (obj, df, ci, boot) eventual community scores. settings List echoing main arguments (reps, cluster_method, exclude_from_graph, exclude_from_cluster, treat_singletons_as_excluded, boot_what).

title: Build MixMashNet metrics from a signed weighted adjacency matrix — mixMN_from_wadj
text: Centrality indices computed signed matrix wadj_signed (via qgraph::centrality), distances closeness betweenness based \(|w|\) edge length \(1/|w|\). Bridge metrics computed separately absolute signed graphs using bridge_metrics() bridge_metrics_excluded().

what: Multilayer MGM with bootstrap, intra/interlayer metrics, and quantile regions — multimixMN
title: Multilayer MGM with bootstrap, intra/interlayer metrics, and quantile regions — multimixMN
text: Estimates multilayer Mixed Graphical Model (MGM) using estimation framework implemented mgm package, masking scheme enforces cross-layer edges allowed according layer_rules. Within layer, function computes community structure performs non-parametric row-bootstrap obtain node centrality indices, edge weights, bridge metrics, including metrics nodes treated excluded. Optionally, within-layer community loadings can also estimated bootstrapped. function additionally returns interlayer-node metrics summaries cross-layer edge weights.

title: Multilayer MGM with bootstrap, intra/interlayer metrics, and quantile regions — multimixMN
code: multimixMN(   data,   layers,   layer_rules,   scale = TRUE,   reps = 100,   lambdaSel = c("CV", "EBIC"),   lambdaFolds = 5,   lambdaGam = 0.25,   alphaSeq = 1,   alphaSel = "CV",   alphaFolds = 5,   alphaGam = 0.25,   k = 2,   ruleReg = "AND",   threshold = "LW",   overparameterize = FALSE,   thresholdCat = TRUE,   quantile_level = 0.95,   covariates = NULL,   exclude_from_cluster = NULL,   seed_model = NULL,   seed_boot = NULL,   treat_singletons_as_excluded = FALSE,   cluster_method = c("louvain", "fast_greedy", "infomap", "walktrap", "edge_betweenness"),   compute_loadings = TRUE,   boot_what = c("general_index", "interlayer_index", "bridge_index", "excluded_index",     "community", "loadings"),   save_data = FALSE,   progress = TRUE )

title: Multilayer MGM with bootstrap, intra/interlayer metrics, and quantile regions — multimixMN
text: data data.frame (n x p) variables columns. Variables may numeric, integer, logical, factors. Character Date/POSIXt variables supported must converted prior model fitting. Variable types internally mapped MGM types follows: numeric variables treated Gaussian; integer variables treated Poisson unless take values {0,1}, case treated binary categorical; factors logical variables treated categorical. Binary categorical variables (two-level factors logical variables) internally recoded {0,1} model fitting. original input data modified. layers named vector (names = variable names) assigning node layer (character factor). Must cover columns data except variables listed covariates (treated adjustment covariates). layer_rules logical numeric square matrix row/column names equal layer names. Values TRUE 1 indicate cross-layer edges allowed corresponding layer pair. Intralayer edges always allowed. scale Logical; TRUE (default) Gaussian variables (type == "g") z-standardized internally mgm(). Use scale = FALSE data already standardized. reps Integer (>= 0). Number bootstrap replications (row resampling replacement). reps = 0, bootstrap performed. lambdaSel Method lambda selection mgm: "CV" "EBIC". lambdaFolds Number folds CV (lambdaSel = "CV"). lambdaGam EBIC gamma parameter (lambdaSel = "EBIC"). alphaSeq Alpha parameters elastic net penalty (values 0 1). alphaSel Method selecting alpha parameter: "CV" "EBIC". alphaFolds Number folds CV (alphaSel = "CV"). alphaGam EBIC gamma parameter (alphaSel = "EBIC"). k Integer (>= 1). Order modeled interactions. ruleReg Rule combine neighborhood estimates: "" "". threshold Threshold edge-weights set zero: "LW", "HW" "none". overparameterize Logical; TRUE uses -parameterized version mgm. thresholdCat Logical; FALSE thresholds categorical variables set zero. quantile_level Level central bootstrap quantile region (default 0.95). Must single number 0 1 (e.g., 0.90, 0.95, 0.99). covariates Character vector. Variables used adjustment covariates model estimation. exclude_from_cluster Character vector node names. Nodes set excluded community detection addition covariates. seed_model Optional integer seed reproducibility initial MGM fit. seed_boot Optional integer seed passed future.apply reproducibility bootstrap replications. treat_singletons_as_excluded Logical; TRUE, singleton communities (size 1) treated "excluded" computing bridge metrics related summaries. cluster_method Community detection algorithm applied within layer. One "louvain", "fast_greedy", "infomap", "walktrap", "edge_betweenness". compute_loadings Logical; TRUE (default), compute network loadings (EGAnet net.loads) communities. boot_what Character vector specifying quantities bootstrap. Valid options : "general_index" (intralayer centrality indices), "interlayer_index" (interlayer-node metrics), "bridge_index" (bridge metrics nodes communities), "excluded_index" (bridge metrics nodes treated excluded), "community" (community memberships), "loadings" (within-layer community loadings, compute_loadings = TRUE), "none" (skip node-level bootstrap: edge-weight bootstrap performed reps > 0). save_data Logical; TRUE, store original data output object. progress Logical; TRUE (default), show bootstrap progress bar.

title: Multilayer MGM with bootstrap, intra/interlayer metrics, and quantile regions — multimixMN
text: object class c("mixmashnet", "multimixMN_fit"). returned list contains least following components: call matched function call. data_info List information derived input data used model setup:     mgm_type_level (data frame one row per variable, reporting     original R class inferred MGM type level,     used call mgm::mgm),     binary_recode_map (named list describing mapping     original binary labels internal {0,1} coding used model fitting). settings List main settings used call, including    reps, cluster_method, covariates,     exclude_from_cluster, treat_singletons_as_excluded,     boot_what). model List :     mgm (fitted mgm object),     nodes (character vector node names),     n (number observations),     p (number variables),     data. layers List describing multilayer structure     (assignment nodes layers, layer_rules matrix used color layer palette). layer_fits Named list (one element per layer)     single layer fits, including community structure, node-level statistics,     edge-level statistics, bridge metrics, (optionally) community loadings     bootstrap information. interlayer List collecting interlayer-node metrics   (strength, expected influence, closeness, betweenness, without   bootstrap) cross-layer edge summaries allowed pair   layers. graph List containing global igraph object built   retained nodes (keep_nodes_graph), vertex attributes   name, layer, membership, edge attributes   weight, abs_weight, sign,   type (intra vs inter) layer_pair.

title: Multilayer MGM with bootstrap, intra/interlayer metrics, and quantile regions — multimixMN
text: function call future::plan(). enable parallel bootstrap, set plan (e.g. future::plan(multisession)) calling multimixMN(). "none" element boot_what reps > 0, node-level metrics bootstrapped, intra interlayer edge-weight bootstrap corresponding quantile regions still computed.

title: Multilayer MGM with bootstrap, intra/interlayer metrics, and quantile regions — multimixMN
text: Haslbeck, J. M. B., & Waldorp, L. J. (2020). mgm: Estimating Time-Varying Mixed Graphical Models High-Dimensional Data. Journal Statistical Software, 93(8). doi:10.18637/jss.v093.i08

ALT Alanine aminotransferase (numeric). AST Aspartate aminotransferase (numeric). GGT Gamma-glutamyl transferase (numeric). Bilirubin Bilirubin (numeric). Albumin Albumin (numeric). TotProtein Total protein (numeric). HbA1c Glycated hemoglobin (numeric). hsCRP High-sensitivity C-reactive protein (numeric). BMI Body mass index (numeric). Waist waist circumference (numeric). Height Height (numeric). ArmCirc Arm circumference (numeric). HipCirc Hip circumference (numeric). LegLength Leg length (numeric). ArmLength Arm Length (numeric). TroubleSleep Trouble Sleep 0=1=yes. PhysicalActivity Physical Activity 0=1=yes. Smoke Smoking 0=1=yes. Drug Drug use 0=1=yes. Diet Dietary quality 1=Poor, 2=Fair, 3=Good, 4=good, 5=Excellent. Alcohol Alcohol consumption 0=1=yes. Work Employment status 1=working, 2=employed absent, 3=seeking work, 4=working. MonInc Monthly income category (1–12), higher values indicate higher income. Gender Gender 0=male 1=female. Age Age (numeric).

what: Plot method for MixMashNet objects — plot.mixmashnet
title: Plot method for MixMashNet objects — plot.mixmashnet
text: Unified plotting interface objects returned mixMN() multimixMN(). Depending , can: = "network": plot estimated network         (single layer multilayer); = "intra": plot intralayer node/edge statistics         bootstrap quantile regions level stored object (centrality bridge metrics); = "inter": plot interlayer node metrics interlayer         edge weights bootstrap quantile regions level stored object (multilayer ),         chosen statistics; = "stability": plot node stability within communities         based bootstrap community assignments.

title: Plot method for MixMashNet objects — plot.mixmashnet
code: # S3 method for class 'mixmashnet' plot(x, what = c("network", "intra", "inter", "stability"), layer = NULL, ...)

title: Plot method for MixMashNet objects — plot.mixmashnet
text: x object class mixmashnet, returned mixMN() multimixMN(). Type plot produce. One c("network","intra","inter","stability"). layer Optional layer name. = "intra" = "stability" multimixMN_fit object, selects layer-specific fit use. ... Additional arguments passed underlying helpers: = "intra": forwarded plotCentrality(),         e.g. statistics, ordering, standardize,         edges_top_n, exclude_nodes, color_by_community. = "inter": forwarded plotInterlayer(),         e.g. statistics, pairs, edges_top_n,         ordering, standardize, nodes_layer. = "stability": forwarded         membershipStab_plot(), e.g. title. = "network": forwarded internal network         plotting helpers .plot_network_single()         .plot_network_multi(), e.g. color_by,         edge_color_by, vertex_size.

title: Plot method for MixMashNet objects — plot.mixmashnet
text: != "network", function returns ggplot object. = "network", network plotted directly.

title: Summarize MixMashNet fits (single and multilayer) in long format — summary.mixmashnet
code: # S3 method for class 'mixmashnet' summary(   object,   what = c("intra", "inter"),   statistics = NULL,   layer = NULL,   pairs = NULL,   digits = 3,   ... )

title: Summarize MixMashNet fits (single and multilayer) in long format — summary.mixmashnet
text: object object class "mixmashnet" returned mixMN() multimixMN(). Character string indicating part model summarize: "intra": intralayer quantities (node-level indices /    intralayer edges); "inter": interlayer quantities (node-level indices     interlayer-graph /cross-layer edges; multilayer fits ). statistics Character vector specifying statistics include.   = "intra", valid values :   c("edges",          "strength", "expected_influence", "closeness", "betweenness",          "bridge_strength", "bridge_closeness", "bridge_betweenness",          "bridge_ei1", "bridge_ei2",          "bridge_strength_excluded", "bridge_betweenness_excluded",          "bridge_closeness_excluded", "bridge_ei1_excluded",          "bridge_ei2_excluded"). = "inter", valid values :   c("edges", "strength", "expected_influence", "closeness",          "betweenness"). statistics = NULL, : = "intra", available intralayer statistics       (including "edges") returned; = "inter", available interlayer statistics       (including "edges") returned. layer Optional character vector layer names subset. Used = "intra" multilayer fits. Ignored single layer fits. pairs Optional character vector layer-pair names (e.g. "bio_dis") used = "inter" summarizing interlayer edges. NULL, available layer pairs included. interlayer node indices, pairs can used restrict summary nodes belonging one layers given pair. digits Number digits round numeric summaries. ... used (S3 compatibility).

title: Summarize MixMashNet fits (single and multilayer) in long format — summary.mixmashnet
text: list (class "summary.mixmashnet") four data frames ($index, $edges, $interlayer_index, $interlayer_edges) quantile region used compute bootstrap quantile regions ($quantile_level). Depending statistics, elements may   NULL.

what: Update community and layer color palettes in MixMashNet objects — update_palette
title: Update community and layer color palettes in MixMashNet objects — update_palette
text: Updates color palettes associated communities /layers mixMN_fit multimixMN_fit objects. function replaces colors corresponding provided names, leaving colors unchanged. colors provided names exist object (e.g., unknown community labels layer names), warning issued entries ignored. communities layers specified, original colors preserved.

title: Update community and layer color palettes in MixMashNet objects — update_palette
Update community and layer color palettes in MixMashNet objects — update_palette
text: fit object class mixMN_fit multimixMN_fit. community_colors Optional named character vector specifying new colors communities. Names must correspond existing community labels (stored communities$palette). Missing names ignored. layer_colors Optional named character vector specifying new colors layers. Names must correspond existing layer names (stored layers$palette). applicable multimixMN_fit objects.

title: Update community and layer color palettes in MixMashNet objects — update_palette
text: input object fit, updated community /layer palettes.

title: Update community and layer color palettes in MixMashNet objects — update_palette
text: mixMN_fit objects, community colors updated fit$communities$palette. multimixMN_fit objects, community colors updated separately within layer (.e., fit$layer_fits[[L]]$communities$palette), layer colors updated fit$layers$palette. function performs -place modification palettes returns updated object.
